page.title: 12DOFFCOCKER LODGE,BOLTON.
page.content: What has happened to our lodge? I can remember mats of reeds floating as though someone had woven them, sunsets reflecting on the rippling water, stormy winds making the waves crash on the stones of the banking,ducks dive-bombing into the water.What has happened to our lodge?It is now a muddy scrapyard.The beautiful water has gone,leaving nothing but rubbish,grey-brown mud and murky gravel.It is a lonely place with no real life.Some birds come but it does not seem alive any more.I feel there is nothing else there alive but me. It must not be nice for the people who bought a house with a good view.But it is still alive!The stream still runs,waiting for the plug to be put in again.Frogs still live in the ditches.They have not given up. (Tim Hampson)
